title: Eduardo Álvarez (tennis)
text:
Eduardo Álvarez (born 28 August 1950) is a Venezuelan former <a href="tennis">tennis</a> player.
Álvarez, who was born in <a href="Caracas">Caracas</a>, made his only appearance for the <a href="Venezuela%20Davis%20Cup%20team">Venezuela Davis Cup team</a> in a 1966 American Zone quarter-final tie against the <a href="Caribbean/West%20Indies%20Davis%20Cup%20team">Caribbean/West Indies</a>. He was called upon in the doubles and teamed up with <a href="Isa%C3%ADas%20Pimentel">Isaías Pimentel</a> to beat the Jamaican pairing of <a href="Lance%20Lumsden">Lance Lumsden</a> and <a href="Richard%20Russell%20%28tennis%29">Richard Russell</a> in five sets.
At the <a href="1966%20Central%20American%20and%20Caribbean%20Games">1966 Central American and Caribbean Games</a> in San Juan, Álvarez won a bronze medal for Venezuela in the mixed doubles event, partnering Beatriz Raytler.
